input: It may be, time will tell, that we will regret the governor's action (implementing Medicaid).  But we have a Superior Court opinion it was within his authority to do that. input: Sadly, you have hypotheticals in your narrative as well, James. 13 years ago I was with my sons in an Indian restaurant in downtown San Francisco. input: Do some homework before making assumptions about the costs of private prisons. Firstly, the prisoners were brought back to Alaska to be closer to their support networks. instruction: Categorize the comment on the basis of severe toxicity. If the comment is severely toxic output Yes, otherwise output No.
input:
Thanks for sharing the link to crosscountryalaska.org/trails, Bartender -- it's definitely a good source of information. Snowio.com is another great tool, as well.

I started this map to record observations because I found that every time I'd talk to someone about hiking a trail, we'd always ask each other what the conditions are like. The map at crosscountryalaska.org seems geared toward skiers specifically, and I couldn't find a map that had the functionality I wanted -- namely, photos added to posts from each area. 

I'm not claiming originality, but a map like this was a resource that I personally, as someone who gets outside as much as possible, thought would be useful in making sure we all go out prepared for the conditions. And to have a broad user base (hikers, skiers, bikers, paddlers, climbers, etc.) was a consideration so you could find all your beta in one spot.

If you have suggestions to improve the map, though, I'd love to hear from you.

instruction: Categorize the comment on the basis of severe toxicity. If the comment is severely toxic output Yes, otherwise output No.
input: The government used to put out it's bids "Three years of experience or a bachelors degree". There was wisdom back then as to just what a piece of paper was worth. Now it's gotten to the point where the piece of paper has overcome real experience and common sense and often wrongs are righted by changing circumstances. Time to look at what is really needed in a college degree and teach what is needed and common sense and not have a bloated system with courses that don't pertain to majors. As a parent who wasn't fortunate enough to get a degree but sent a daughter through the system to receive her engineering degree I resent having paid for the little extras that were required and large classes taught by assistant professors. Colleges are set up as money gobbling institutions and way over priced and it's good to see the bowels opened up by budget crises. I'm not saying that higher education is not needed or required and is a must in certain fields but it's not the answer for every one.

instruction: Categorize the comment on the basis of severe toxicity. If the comment is severely toxic output Yes, otherwise output No.
input: Clearly the Murkowskis understand nothing about the environment.  I've been to these islands, that took tens of thousands of years to evolve their unique biological populations.  The cattle are ruining them in short order.  People screwed up the ecology of these islands and people need to restore them to their original, natural condition.  These are just stupid cows, for God's sake.  Just because they can live there doesn't mean they should live there. Their hooves are cutting in and turning precious tundra into mud.  And they are destroying rare, valuable indigenous species of native plants and animals. Kill them all and let them rot.
